TopicTitle: Caterpillar Tracks- NOW OPEN SOURCE, ALL FILES OPEN TO PUBLIC

Articles.Content:
So now I have some good news, and some good(er) news.

Good news: 6.forty has made some great progress on the new plugin. Most of the features are there, but not all (The most notable being the suspension).

Good(er) news: I am now looking for some testers. There are however some minor preferences for testing, so read those before you apply.

--You must understand that you cannot become a tester simply for the sake of getting the new plugin early (thats right, only the plugin is new. You'll be testing with the older tracks).

--Understand that these are not complete, they are completely unbalanced and do not have some of the functions yet.

--If you can prove yourself to be a reputable tester, please do so (This would include any references/links etc).

--You should know how to edit cfg's.

--Your mission is to break these things. Fly them, crash them, make huge monsters with them, throw them at Jool, feed them to the space kraken.

--report any (undocumented) bugs you find, to me. I'll then pass them to 6.forty if theyre plugin related, and to myself if theyre visual.

You'll get a thanks in the release thread (and maybe a virtual cookie).

If you wanna be a tester, message me here on the forums. Keep in mind though that testing positions are very limited (keeping it a low number).

- (1 and 2)i understand and fully comply with these rules/regulations.

-i've helped people in the past with simple config edits and the like (B9 with the animation bug for the H-50 landing legs and the old version of this trying to figure out how to get the tracks moving via messing around with torque curves)

-Woot! i wouldn't mind bashing them into kerbin for you ^.^

-ok gotcha reporting back if need be.

also instead of a cookie could i get rep? cookies are bad for me
Alright I have decided who the testers will be, and will be messaging them later today with the test pack. So applications are now finished. Thanks for those who applied, I appreciate it all!

Edited March 26, 2014 by AntiMatter001

I don't know for sure what config you're using, but it sounds like the config is way off what it probably should be if you're hitting that speed. If you can swerve side to side with no forward throttle and still gain speed, RollingResistance is too small or your torque curve is much too strong.

I don't know for sure what config you're using, but it sounds like the config is way off what it probably should be if you're hitting that speed. If you can swerve side to side with no forward throttle and still gain speed, RollingResistance is too small or your torque curve is much too strong.

no i fixed that already (i had just played with the tracks as is without messing around to see if i could see any bugs with a direct install) by looking at the old configs and putting their torque curve values in it. seems to work like real tracks now...

also 6.forty thanks alot for updating the .dll this mod needs to be in ksp and ilove it!

ElectronicFox: How long is this testing going to last?

I dont like putting up a schedule or specific dates, since dates are all too often missed and everyone has other obligations. BUT, I will say I hope to have this release-worthy within the next week or two, depending on how major any found bugs may be.

The issues shown here are from an incomplete part of the plugin (the beginnings of procedural tracks). The trackwidth seems to stem from the pivot-points of the track meshes, which currently arent set properly to allow for this function.

The issues shown here are from an incomplete part of the plugin (the beginnings of procedural tracks). The trackwidth seems to stem from the pivot-points of the track meshes, which currently arent set properly to allow for this function.
